title: Champ Select needs an update please.
body:
I am getting frustrated with champion select. I am a Solo queue player and I do not microphone or voice chat. Now that I am playing more ranked games than blind pick and really trying to win. I am working with others more and more often to make good team compositions and select strong champions. I play all positions from top lane to bot lane with a decent champion pool. 

When I start a match I try to pick and ban and talk with other players about who they want, where they want to go, and if they would like to trade. During  this time we are on a timer looking at huge wall of champions with no names and when hovered over we cannot see chat and have to make decisions fairly quickly, so please hear me out. 

Here is what i would like to see

1. Champion favorites section of the champions I love to play and are really good with

2. Easy to click categories 
           Please keep alphabetical listing. This I feel is part of the essence of champion select, but also add role selectors, tank, fighter, marksman, ect..  (yes I know you can type it in, however again I am on a timer I  have little time for typing especially if I am typing to a teammate. In a last minute decision I sometimes cannot find a champion fast enough and I lose LP by timing out trying to help the team get a win by picking a champion that would make our team stronger. very frustrating and unfair.)

3. Add champion names under there pictures
            With all of the reworks, and visual updates (which are awesome) it is hard to keep up with all of the new portraits and when I hover over a champion to see which champion it is. My chat gets covered up by champion information that is fairly vague and that I usually already know. It makes my decision harder and less about the teamwork because I cannot see what we are working out in chat. So either take off the champion information,  move it, and add champion names PLEASE!

Thanks for listening 
Best wishes to all and remember GL HF :)

replies.body: What I'd like is for there to be some time before the banning starts where people could chat, even if it's just "pls don't ban morg". It would make life easier, especially for blue side.
This. In addition to chat during the loading screen so teams can discuss strategy while waiting. Chat should just be available for a time before and after the ban/select phase.
Also people should pick preferred roles and make them visible without having to use chat, it would make champ select a lot faster
That's a good idea and preferable to the suggestions regarding a Team Builder type implementation for Ranked Solo.

> What I'd like is for there to be some time before the banning starts where people could chat, even if it's just "pls don't ban morg". It would make life easier, especially for blue side.

This and numbers 1-3 would make champion select a lot better.

Great idea, I'd love something like 30 seconds before banning. This would encourage people to pick roles and champions earlier, instead of remaining silently and suddenly locking in Teemo, as well as reduce "WTF U BANNED YI SO FKING STUPID AFK"

I think it might be beneficial if you hover your cursor over whatever team-mate you have, it could show you their top 3 played characters, and also their top 3 ban picks. This gives you a quick idea what role they like to play, who they like to play, and who they don't like to play against.

For one the  pictures could be downsized. I'd say some good ideas are:
---
1: Add a slider for thumbnail sizes, perfect option for users of monitors in any size/resolution.
---
2: Have fun with text presentation options (aesthetically). Perhaps when you mouse over them, a thumbnail become visible. So instead of viewing 120+ thumbnails at once, instead you are given an alphabetical list. Again, make this a check-marked option.
---
3: Implement a system akin to team builder, where after the banning phase (a lot of people tend to change roles after a banning phase), each team member selects the role they want to play from top to bottom. instead of those battling and arguing through text. This allows bans to be distributed while the team discusses roles, then a visual display of those roles after the banning phase is given (for those that dont pay attention, if you don't choose, you are automated to "Fill." I suppose you could even go the extra mile and add preferred position selection while searching for a game.
---
4: Have The chat appear out of champion select as an arranged chat, ALA the pre-lobby organized team chat.
---
5: Have selected skin Art appear as your selected champion. (see attachment)
---

The chatbox is tiny and scrolls fast. People often afk to get some water or whatever. I think it would make sense to let us have an easy-to-see statement of our preferred roles, so we can keep track of who wants what. Just let us set our preferred roles and our least-favorite role, and have that appear next to our name.

http://i.imgur.com/heuP6Je.jpg

Purely a signalling system: it's not Team Builder. It's just easier than having to bang out "mid or supp pref" every match, or constantly ask, "wait narutoslayer420, where do you want to go?"
How about a report button during champion select so if you dodge to avoid a troll the troll doesn't get off scott free.

I like the idea of team builder type selection process without selecting a champion along with the role (for ranked). That way, when you get into champ select, everyone can just type- 
Jon: top
Bill: Mid
Chris: ADC
Etc...
Or, people's names are a certain color
Jon(top) is red
Bill(mid) is white
Chris(ADC) is blue
Etc..
it cuts down arguments. Once in lobby, everyone knows where everyone is going, That way.. If you WANT TO PLAY ADC in ranked, you are guaranteed the slot on the team.
I have witnessed, the happier people are in team select lobby, the less likely a team/person is to turn toxic.

I typically have a pre-set list of ban able champions, with backups in case someone throws a "don't ban X" into the mix.. However, not everyone is as prepared and some team captains railroad the game before the match even starts.
You know, with all the champion-specific quality of life buffs... this is an excellent series of ideas.
